de.cau.cs.kieler.sim.kiem.views
Class KiemView

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.core.commands.common.EventManager
      org.eclipse.ui.part.WorkbenchPart
          org.eclipse.ui.part.ViewPart
              de.cau.cs.kieler.sim.kiem.views.KiemView
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension, org.eclipse.ui.IPersistable, org.eclipse.ui.IViewPart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart2, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart3, org.eclipse.ui.part.IWorkbenchPartOrientation
public class KiemView
extends org.eclipse.ui.part.ViewPart

The Class KiemView is only instantiated once when the view part is registered in the Eclipse IDE. It holds the DataComponent table list view and buttons to control the execution.

Author:
Christian Motika - cmot AT informatik.uni-kiel.de

Method Detail

refreshEnabledDisabledTextColors

private void refreshEnabledDisabledTextColors()
Refreshes the text colors of enabled or master components. Disabled DataComponents will get a gray text color, enabled master components are indicated by a blue text color.

setAllEnabled

private void setAllEnabled(boolean enabled)
Sets the all actions (tool bar buttons and context menu entires) to enabled or disabled. This method is used to block any user input during the initialization phase for example.

Parameters:
enabled - the new enabled status

updateEnabled

private void updateEnabled()
Updates the enableness of the actions that control the execution. If a master is present, the this functionality may be implemented by him.

getActionAdd

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionAdd()
Gets the action add. It calls the AddDataComponentDialog to let the user select a DataComponent to add. This will be added (and hence instantiated) by calling the KiemPlugin.addTodataComponentExList(de.cau.cs.kieler.sim.kiem.extension.DataComponent) method of the KIEM plug-in.

Returns:
the action add

getActionDelete

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionDelete()
Gets the action delete. Deletes all selected DataComponentExs from the DataComponentExList.

Returns:
the action delete

getActionEnableDisable

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionEnableDisable()
Gets the action enable disable. Enables or disables all selected DataComponentExs.

Returns:
the action enable disable

getActionUp

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionUp()
Gets the action up. Schedules all selected DataComponentExs before their current position (if possible).

Returns:
the action up

getActionDown

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionDown()
Gets the action down. Schedules all selected DataComponentExs behind their current positions (if possible).

Returns:
the action down

getActionStepBack

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionStepBack()
Gets the action step back. Triggers the execution to make a step back. If a master is present, the this functionality may be implemented by him.

Returns:
the action step back

getActionStep

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionStep()
Gets the action step. Triggers the execution to make a step. If a master is present, the this functionality may be implemented by him.

Returns:
the action step

getActionMacroStep

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionMacroStep()
Gets the action macro step. Triggers the execution to make a macro step. If a master is present, the this functionality may be implemented by him.

Returns:
the action macro step

getActionRun

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionRun()
Gets the action run. Triggers the execution to go into run mode. If a master is present, the this functionality may be implemented by him.

Returns:
the action run

getActionPause

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionPause()
Gets the action pause. Triggers the execution to pause. If a master is present, the this functionality may be implemented by him.

Returns:
the action pause

getActionStop

private org.eclipse.jface.action.Action getActionStop()
Gets action stop. Triggers the execution to stop. If a master is present, the this functionality may be implemented by him.
All collected timing data will be presented to the user and the execution is being released. A master will also have to do this.

Returns:
the action stop

the aimed step duration text field

setFocus

public void setFocus()
Passing the focus request to the viewer's control. This is necessary be- cause KiemView extends the ViewPart class.

Specified by:
setFocus in interface org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart
Specified by:
setFocus in class org.eclipse.ui.part.WorkbenchPart

checkForSingleEnabledMaster

public void checkForSingleEnabledMaster(boolean silent)
Check for single enabled master. This is just a wrapper for the method checkForSingleEnabledMaster(boolean, DataComponentEx).

Parameters:
silent - if true, the warning dialog will be suppressed

checkForSingleEnabledMaster

public void checkForSingleEnabledMaster(boolean silent,
                                        DataComponentEx dataComponentEx)
Check the current selection (enabled DataComponentExs) for a just a single enabled master. If any second enabled master is found it will be disabled and the user is notified with a warning dialog - depending on the silent-flag.

Parameters:
silent - if true, the warning dialog will be suppressed
dataComponentEx - the DataComponentEx that is allowed to be the master or null
